intro: Byttneria asplundii, commonly known as the African snowball tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its dense clusters of white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its bark is smooth and light-colored. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds.
